children: A 59-year-old man is hospitalized with acute hypoxemic respiratory failure requiring intubation.
Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

This frontal chest radiograph reveals bilateral alveolar opacifications with air bronchograms, consistent with pneumonia. The right and left hemidiaphragms are each partially obscured, with placement of infiltrates in the right and left lower lobes, respectively. The right heart border is partially obscured, and an infiltrate within the right middle lobe is also possible.

objective.__html: Recognize the radiographic findings of multilobar pneumonia.
